label: 不諭祖田
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Rice fields that paid no tax of rice on paddy fields (so) to the government, since that tax went to the owner of the land instead, this owner later coming to be called the Lord of Manors (Ryōshu). [領主]
